content.heroIntro: Welcome to INFINITY BEACH VILLAS, an exclusive development by AGROBUBIANA LEVANTE in Nuevo Ribera, la Nucia. This sophisticated villa community offers three-bedroom, four-bathroom properties with built sizes of 141m² on generous 213m² plots, priced from just €600,000. Designed for discerning buyers seeking the perfect balance between coastal living and modern comfort, these villas represent an exceptional opportunity in one of Costa Blanca's most sought-after locations. With delivery scheduled for September 2026, AGROBUBIANA LEVANTE brings their expertise in quality construction and attention to detail to create homes that truly stand out. Whether you're seeking a permanent residence, a holiday retreat, or a smart investment, INFINITY BEACH VILLAS delivers contemporary living with easy access to pristine beaches, championship golf courses, and a thriving international community.

locationSection.intro: Nuevo Ribera in la Nucia is a vibrant residential area that perfectly captures the Costa Blanca lifestyle. Nestled between the Mediterranean Sea and the stunning Sierra de la Ala mountains, this location offers an ideal blend of natural beauty and modern convenience. la Nucia has emerged as a premier destination for international buyers, with an established English-speaking community and excellent infrastructure. The area features outstanding healthcare facilities, quality shopping centers, and a diverse culinary scene. Multiple Blue Flag beaches are just 20 minutes away, offering pristine sands and crystal-clear waters. For golf enthusiasts, several championship courses are within easy reach. The regional hospital ensures peace of mind, while international schools provide excellent education options. This is where modern Spanish living meets international standards.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain. As a non-EU buyer, you will need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number) and must comply with certain Spanish tax obligations. AGROBUBIANA LEVANTE and local legal advisors can guide you through the process, which is straightforward and well-established.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, typical costs include transfer tax (6-10% depending on the region), legal fees (€800-1,500), notary fees (€400-800), and property registration fees. For a €600,000 property, expect additional costs of approximately €48,000-72,000. Your legal advisor can provide a detailed breakdown.
